info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 9:54PM CDT until July 26 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following counties, Ogle and southernmost Winnebago.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Roads and streets may be flooded. Slow moving or standing water may continue.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockford, Rochelle, Byron, Davis Junction, Hillcrest, Stillman Valley, New Milford, Creston, Lindenwood, Monroe Center, Kings and Chana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT SATURDAY
